channel.title: Image_recognition on Computational Creativity and Archaeological Data
channel.description: Recent content in Image_recognition on Computational Creativity and Archaeological Data

item.title: Creating a set of images for image recognition
item.description: crossposted from Jeff’s blog. Jeff is an MA History and Data Science student @CarletonU. I would like to train an image recognition model with my own images to see how well it works. Here I want to use the obverse of coins to make a model to recognize the portraits of Elizabeth II (younger), Elizabeth II (more mature), George VI and Abraham Lincoln. Initially I used 5 cent coins but I found they reflected too much light to take a good photograph so I switched to 1 cent coins.

item.title: Deep Learning with Python, Appendix A
item.description: Jeff’s initial experiment with a Google Colab notebook, on the mnist dataset.

item.title: Two notebooks for taking photos
item.description: A notebook within which you may control your device’s camera to take photos. A notebook for taking photos and removing backgrounds.
